findings.title: GSN integration allows malicious actors to waste Paymaster GSN Relay balance on failing transactions
findings.description: A malicious actor can cause the `Paymaster.postRelayedCall()` hook to revert by not having enough Service Fee Tokens to cover for the gas costs, resulting in the GSN Relay charging the `Paymaster` for the failed transaction.

findings.title: Paymaster.sol: function sellTokenForGas() can be called by anyone
findings.description: A malicious caller could invoke the `Paymaster.sellTokenForGas()` function to change the `latestFee` value in `Paymaster`, allowing payment for transactions using a non-whitelisted `_serviceFeeToken` and causing `Paymaster.postRelayedCall()` to revert, thus incurring failed transaction costs on `Paymaster`.

findings.title: Tokens with optional return values are not supported
findings.description: The contracts EscrowManager and DEXManager expects token transfer and transferFrom methods to always return a value or revert on failure. This implementation will always fail with tokens where these methods return nothing, resulting in locked funds.

findings.title: ERC20 tokens which charge transfer fees are not supported
findings.description: The contracts EscrowManager and DEXManager do not check if the amount received is the same as the amount accounted for. This will work in almost all cases without any issues, except with some rare tokens which change a transfer fee.

findings.title: Miscellaneous notes
findings.description: Improving code quality and readability by resolving unused imports, unnecessary SafeMath usage, misspelled function name, and method mutability.
